article_title: Medtronic Likely to Buy Shares, Repay Debt With Money Transferred From Overseas
article_text:
Medtronic PLC said it would most likely pay off debt and repurchase shares with the $9.8 billion in overseas cash it recently transferred to the U.S., adding that it will update investors soon on its specific plans.

Chief Executive Omar Ishrak also cautioned that the booming growth in hospital procedures of recent years, propelled by the Affordable Care Act, is slowing as the law matures. That boom has benefited Medtronic, which sells devices and surgical tools used in procedures. “Coming into the next couple of months...
